title: The Essential Guide to Wheat Barley and Oats in Farming Simulator 25

tasks.task: Planting and Managing Wheat, Barley, and Oats
subtasks: Selecting appropriate combine harvester and grain header (Lexion 6900 with Macdon Flex Draper)
Seeding wheat, barley, and oats using a seeder (Limpkin Sultar 12) and carefully monitoring seed quantities (e.g., 1,050 liters)
Preparing the field with proper equipment (plowing, calibration, fertilization) for maximum yield (approx. 95% bonus)
Timing plantings for optimal growth and yield (September/October for wheat and barley, March/April for oats)
Monitoring crop growth cycles and applying herbicides for weed control (e.g., 93% yield increase)
Using the Macdon swather for an additional 25% crop yield
Collecting straw after harvesting using a forage wagon (e.g., Tigro 75 VRD) for multiple uses (bedding, TMR, sale)
Storing grain in silos (e.g., brick, concrete, steel silos) and managing straw in hayloft or bale storage
Processing grain through grain mill (flour production) or cereal factory (cereal production)
Feeding straw to animals for bedding and manure, integrating into total mixed rations (TMR) for cattle or water buffalo
Harvesting wheat using a combination of traditional and swathing methods
Handing post-harvest straw yields (e.g., collecting with pickup header and forage wagon)
Using augers and belt systems for grain storage and retrieval in silos
Processing wheat flour through grain mill and using in bakery for bread production
Planting, tending, and harvesting barley and oats following similar procedures as wheat
Producing total mixed rations for cows using straw and manure from bedding
Feeding wheat, barley, and oats to pigs as part of balanced rations
